title: Thor Love and Thunder director Taika Waititi discusses potential cancer storyline

The Marvel Cinematic Universe could be about to feature some hard-hitting subject matter.

Taika Waititi has teased a potential avenue for the fourth film in the Thor series starring Chris Hemsworth as the God of Thunder.

Thor: Love and Thunder will see Natalie Portman return to her role as Dr. Jane Foster, Thor's former love interest, who will become the superheroine known as The Mighty Thor.

In the comics, Jane wields the hammer as the warrior, but whilst undergoing a battle against breast cancer.

Speaking to Variety, Waititi has teased that this medical story could become a part of the film.

"I think that's a really powerful part of the books," said Waititi. "I think it's really cool that she's fighting this thing and there's two battles going on. Personally I really love that storyline. But whether it ends up in the film is yet to be seen."

(Image: Marvel comics)

The Thor: Ragnarok director added: “We’re not sure if we’re going to do a complete lift of that whole storyline. These things change through the shoot and even when we’re editing sometimes.

"Like, ‘Let’s get rid of that storyline where she’s got breast cancer. We’ll change it to something else, or maybe she’s fine.'”

Hemsworth and Portman will be joined in the cast by Tessa Thompson, reprising her role as Valkyrie, who is now the ruler of Asgard following the events of Avengers Endgame.

Thor: Love and Thunder is released in cinemas on November 5, 2021.

description: Thor: Ragnarok director Taika Waititi will helm the fourth solo outing for Chris Hemsworth as the God of Thunder
